article.headline: Maine 75, Hartford 64
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) -- Kevin Reed had 19 points and nine rebounds to lead Maine to a 75-64 win over Hartford Wednesday night. Reed scored 14 points in the first half, including four 3-pointers, to help the Black Bears pull away before the break. Maine (13-7, 7-4 America East) shot 52 percent and hit 6-of-12 from behind the 3-point arc in the first half. Maine led by as many as 26 points in the second half, but Hartford (9-10, 4-6) used a 15-3 run to cut the deficit to 14 points with 7:44 remaining. But the Hawks were never able to get closer than seven points the rest of the way. Aaron Cook led Hartford with 17 points, while Ryan Stys chipped in 15 points and Rich Baker added 12. Eric Dobson had 16 points for Maine. Mark Flavin added 15 points and nine rebounds, and Joe Campbell had eight points and 11 rebounds for the Black Bears.
